alert.note: Alert for Eastern Magic Valley; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Shoshone, Lava Beds; Southern Hills, Albion Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 17 at 7:16AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...AREAS OF PATCHY DENSE FOG ALONG THE INTERSTATE 86 AND 84 TRAVEL CORRIDOR FROM AMERICAN FALLS THROUGH BURLEY... Patchy dense fog was observed along the Interstate 86 and 84 travel corridor from American Falls through Burley this morning. Motorists traveling through this region should be prepared to slow down as they encounter dense fog with visibilty reduced to less than 1/4 mile at times. The fog is expected to last through 10 AM MST this morning. Locations impacted include... Burley, Rupert, American Falls, Heyburn, Neeley, American Falls Reservoir, southern Lake Walcott, Chubbuck, Aberdeen, Paul, Declo, Albion, Minidoka, Cold Water Rest Area, Pocatello Airport, Acequia, Sterling, Yale Rest Area, Massacre Rocks, and Bear Trap Airport. Visibilities are below one quarter of a mile in the fog. If you are driving, slow down and be on alert for other motorists. Low visibility shortens the amount of time you have to react to situations.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Magic Valley; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Shoshone, Lava Beds; Southern Hills, Albion Mountains
